title: Continuous Learning: Advanced Proxmox VE & PBS Management
author: Daniel Florencio

mainImage.src: data:image/svg+xml;charset=UTF-8,%3csvg width='700' height='350' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 700 350' preserveAspectRatio='none'%3e%3crect width='100%25' height='100%25' fill='%23e9ecef'%3e%3c/rect%3e%3c/svg%3e
mainImage.alt: Proxmox VE and PBS logos with server hardware

content.text: My current focus is on taking my Proxmox VE and Proxmox Backup Server (PBS) skills to the next level. I'm driven to build truly robust, highly available, and efficient virtualization environments, covering everything from the foundational setup to intricate advanced configurations and diligent real-time monitoring.
Key Areas I'm Mastering

items: Proxmox VE & PBS: Solidifying best practices for installation, initial setup, and ongoing configuration.
High Availability (HA): Actively working on configuring and testing HA for mission-critical virtual machines and services.
Ceph Integration: Exploring Ceph's potential for scalable and resilient distributed storage within my Proxmox setups.
Building in Redundancy: Strategizing and implementing network and storage redundancy to eliminate single points of failure.
Optimizing Remote Access: Fine-tuning RDP and other remote access methods for seamless VM interaction.
Advanced VM & LXC Management: Honing techniques for efficient template creation, cloning, resource allocation, and full lifecycle management.
Comprehensive Monitoring: Implementing real-time monitoring with Netdata, and looking into Prometheus/Grafana integrations for deeper insights.

content.text: Practical Application and Insights

Much of my learning is hands-on, taking place in my home lab. This allows me to experiment with various HA configurations, simulate failures to truly understand Ceph's resilience, and meticulously fine-tune Netdata alerts. One of the interesting challenges I'm tackling is balancing optimal resource usage with the imperative of maximum uptime.

content.text: My ultimate aim is to gain a deep, practical mastery of Proxmox, enabling me to confidently build and maintain highly reliable and performant virtualization infrastructures for diverse requirements.

title: Continuous Learning: AI, Vibe Coding & Prompt Engineering
author: Daniel Florencio

mainImage.src: data:image/svg+xml;charset=UTF-8,%3csvg width='700' height='350' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 700 350' preserveAspectRatio='none'%3e%3crect width='100%25' height='100%25' fill='%23e9ecef'%3e%3c/rect%3e%3c/svg%3e
mainImage.alt: Abstract representation of AI and prompt engineering

content.text: I'm currently captivated by the evolving landscape of AI. My exploration centers on 'vibe coding'—how AI tools can intuitively enhance the development workflow—and the increasingly vital skill of prompt engineering. I believe that a solid grasp of how AI models 'think' and how to communicate effectively with them is crucial for leveraging them to their full potential.
My Learning Focus in AI

items: LLM Fundamentals: Getting to grips with core concepts like transformers, attention mechanisms, and the processes behind model-generated responses.

Precision in Prompting: Mastering the art of crafting effective prompts, emphasizing the necessity of providing AI with crystal-clear, unambiguous instructions. This ensures outputs precisely align with task requirements and desired outcomes, minimizing ambiguity and rework.
Iterative Prompt Refinement: Developing systematic approaches for testing, analyzing, and enhancing prompts to achieve optimal and consistent AI output quality.

The Essence of Vibe Coding: Investigating how AI code assistants and related tools can augment developer intuition, accelerate development cycles, and streamline complex tasks. This includes understanding how to integrate AI suggestions effectively into existing codebases.

Strategic System Design with AI: Highlighting the critical role of meticulous planning and architecting systems built with or incorporating AI. A well-defined structure is key to efficiently diagnosing, isolating, and rectifying AI-generated errors or unforeseen issues, ensuring the overall system remains maintainable, robust, and adaptable.

Understanding AI Logic & Limitations: Studying the architecture and deployment of AI models to better appreciate their capabilities, inherent biases, and potential limitations. This knowledge is vital for setting realistic expectations and troubleshooting.
Navigating Ethical AI: Reflecting on the ethical considerations of AI-assisted development and content generation, particularly around bias, transparency, accountability, and responsible application.

content.text: Experimentation and Tooling

My approach is very hands-on. I'm actively experimenting with various Large Language Models (like Gemini and the GPT series), using AI-powered code assistants in my projects, and methodically developing and testing prompts for a range of tasks. The goal is to cultivate a strong, intuitive feel for interacting with these powerful AI systems and to understand how to best integrate them into a structured development process.
The synergy between human creativity, strategic planning, and AI's processing power is where true innovation in coding and content creation will emerge.
My objective is to seamlessly and responsibly weave AI tools into my professional workflow, boosting both my productivity and the overall quality and reliability of my work.

title: Continuous Learning: Full-Stack with Vue.js & Django
author: Daniel Florencio

mainImage.src: data:image/svg+xml;charset=UTF-8,%3csvg width='700' height='350' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 700 350' preserveAspectRatio='none'%3e%3crect width='100%25' height='100%25' fill='%23e9ecef'%3e%3c/rect%3e%3c/svg%3e

content.text: Right now, I'm channeling my energy into building complete full-stack web applications. My chosen stack combines Vue.js for creating dynamic and responsive frontends with Django (and Django REST Framework) for its power in crafting robust and scalable backend APIs.
Developing Core Full-Stack Skills

items: Vue.js Proficiency: Deepening my understanding of components, reactivity, Vue Router for seamless navigation, and Pinia/Vuex for effective state management.
Crafting Interactive UIs: Focusing on building engaging user interfaces by leveraging Vue's declarative rendering and powerful component system.
Django & DRF Expertise: Working extensively with Django's ORM and views, and harnessing Django REST Framework for efficient API development (serializers, viewsets, authentication, permissions).
Seamless API Integration: Practicing connecting Vue.js frontends to Django backend APIs, primarily using tools like Axios or the native Fetch API.
Mastering Integration Nuances: Tackling challenges like CORS, managing authentication tokens, and ensuring smooth, reliable data flow between the frontend and backend.

content.text: Learning Through Building

To really solidify these skills, I'm currently developing a [mention your specific project type, e.g., 'comprehensive task management system' or 'a personal portfolio platform with dynamic content']. This project demands a rich frontend experience and a well-structured API, pushing me to design data models in Django, build out the necessary API endpoints, and then create the Vue.js components to bring it all to life.
My ambition is to become highly proficient in creating web applications that are not only seamless and efficient but also maintainable and deliver genuinely great user experiences.

title: Continuous Learning: FreeSWITCH, Lua & Python for Telephony
author: Daniel Florencio

mainImage.src: data:image/svg+xml;charset=UTF-8,%3csvg width='700' height='350' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 700 350' preserveAspectRatio='none'%3e%3crect width='100%25' height='100%25' fill='%23e9ecef'%3e%3c/rect%3e%3c/svg%3e
mainImage.alt: FreeSWITCH logo with Lua and Python icons

content.text: I'm currently immersed in the world of FreeSWITCH, aiming to build sophisticated telephony solutions. A significant part of this journey involves mastering Lua for scripting intricate call control logic, and leveraging Python to develop robust testing tools. These tools are vital for ensuring system redundancy and performance under pressure, particularly in demanding call center environments.
Key Technical Areas I'm Tackling

items: FreeSWITCH Architecture: Gaining a thorough understanding of its core, dialplan, diverse applications, and event system.
Advanced Lua Scripting: Writing custom Lua scripts for dynamic call routing, interactive IVR systems, and complex application logic within FreeSWITCH.
Python for ESL Integration: Utilizing Python to interface with FreeSWITCH's Event Socket Library, enabling external control and detailed monitoring.
Developing Redundancy Tests: Creating Python scripts to automate the testing of failover mechanisms, ensuring high availability is not just theoretical.

Concurrent Call & Load Testing: Building Python scripts (sometimes integrating with tools like `sipp`) to simulate high volumes of concurrent calls, effectively stress-testing call center infrastructure.
In-depth Performance Analysis: Learning to analyze call detail records (CDRs) and system logs to pinpoint bottlenecks and optimize overall performance.

content.text: Focusing on Production Readiness for Call Centers

A major emphasis in my learning is on the practicalities of preparing a FreeSWITCH-based call center for the rigors of production. This means conducting thorough load testing to accurately identify capacity limits and to be confident the system can handle peak business hours without issues.

title: Continuous Learning: Crafting Educational Content with Notion & Canva
author: Daniel Florencio

mainImage.src: data:image/svg+xml;charset=UTF-8,%3csvg width='700' height='350' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg' viewBox='0 0 700 350' preserveAspectRatio='none'%3e%3crect width='100%25' height='100%25' fill='%23e9ecef'%3e%3c/rect%3e%3c/svg%3e
mainImage.alt: Notion and Canva logos with educational icons

content.text: As a tutor, I'm always looking for ways to enhance my teaching. Currently, I'm focusing on creating more engaging and well-structured lessons and quizzes for my students. My go-to tools for this are Notion, for its incredible organizational power, and Canva, for bringing a professional visual polish to the materials.
My Evolving Content Creation Workflow

items: Strategic Curriculum Design in Notion: I use Notion's databases and pages to meticulously structure lesson plans, define clear learning objectives, and map out entire course outlines.

Developing Interactive Learning Materials: My aim is to create comprehensive notes within Notion, embedding relevant external resources like videos and articles, and organizing all information logically.

Elevating Visuals with Canva: I rely on Canva to design presentations, worksheets, infographics, and summary sheets that are not only clear and informative but also visually engaging and easy for students to digest.

Thoughtful Quiz and Assessment Development: I'm exploring Notion's capabilities for creating formative quizzes and also linking to specialized quiz platforms, always using Canva to enhance any visual elements in assessments.
Exploring Personalized Learning Paths: I'm investigating how Notion can help me track student progress and tailor resources to individual needs more effectively.
Commitment to Feedback and Iteration: I see content creation as an ongoing process, continuously refining materials based on student feedback and observed learning outcomes.

content.alt: Placeholder for a sample lesson slide created with Canva

content.text: Harnessing the Strengths of Each Tool

I'm really digging into Notion's databases, linked views, and templates to make my content management as efficient as possible. With Canva, I focus on leveraging its vast library of templates and design elements. This allows me to produce professional-quality visuals quickly, ensuring my educational content is not just informative but genuinely motivating for my students.

My ultimate goal here is to significantly elevate the learning experience for my students. I want to provide them with exceptionally clear, well-structured, and visually engaging educational resources that resonate with diverse learning styles and truly help them succeed.
